thread.title: World view: Sounds of the forest, Estonia | Travel
thread.title_full: World view: Sounds of the forest, Estonia | Travel | The Guardian

author: The Guardian
title: World view: Sounds of the forest, Estonia | Travel
text:
“If there’s a bustle in your hedgerow, don’t be alarmed now”... it’s just the sounds of the forest being amplified by three giant wooden megaphones that have been installed in a clearing of the Pähni nature centre in southern Estonia. Designed by a group of architecture students from the Estonian Academy of Arts, the three-metre-diameter megaphones are large enough for ramblers to sit inside and tune in to nature – the rustling of the leaves, the footsteps of creatures living on the forest floor, birdsong and rainfall. It’s sort of like a forest bandstand. Photograph: Tonu Tunnel/AFP/Getty Images The Guardian
Thursday 8 October 2015 11.48 BST
